intro: Dichaetanthera oblongifolia var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dichaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
